<<I understand the PMK Nagakura version is very cute but the site I
went to was obviously referring to the historic people because (many
references to historic S.H.) although the women were attracted to
Hijikata they were kind of "afraid" of him.>>

Maybe many of those folks have had the opportunity to read the book he 
wrote. Perhaps he speaks of himself and those he came in contact with in 
such a way that he comes across as a general "nice guy".

I know that I would certainly LOVE to learn more about the Shinsengumi 
members not only during their time in Kyoto but also before and after. 
Maybe, just maybe the Hillsborough book will give us that. I was able to 
get his Samurai Sketches through the library and I thought it was very 
well done, it's a definite "have to buy" book on my list.
